positive.review:
DayZ 3,000 Hours Later

This game just keeps on giving.

At first itâ€™s brutal. Thereâ€™s no tutorial or hand-holding. You learn by dying again and again, but thatâ€™s part of what makes it so good. The learning curve is steep, but once you start figuring things out it becomes incredibly rewarding. Thereâ€™s always something new to learn like sickness, hypothermia, fractures, finding food, clean water and of course surviving other players.

You canâ€™t trust anyone in DayZ, but sometimes giving a little trust can lead to some of the best and most memorable moments youâ€™ll ever have in a game.

Every time you log in it feels like a new story. No two sessions are ever the same and thatâ€™s what keeps it fresh even after all these years.

The game is around 13 years old now and still has a huge player base which says a lot. I recommend joining a community server with active admins as it makes a big difference. Most have Discords where you can meet people and group up. Personally I play on The Better Vanilla and it has everything I need.

After 3,000 hours I still havenâ€™t gotten bored. Itâ€™s one of those games where you never really know whatâ€™s going to happen next.

Think about it. You can spend the same amount of money on a cinema ticket, drink and popcorn for two hours of fun. DayZ gives you thousands of hours of chaos, stories and pure survival. Totally worth it.

The Agonizing, Unforgiving, Brilliant 7/10 Masterpiece

Review:

To review DayZ is, in itself, an act of survival. You must endure hours of hardship, frustration, and existential dread, only to emerge on the other side, blinking into the sun, unsure if youâ€™ve just had a profound experience or wasted 500 hours of your life. The answer, as it turns out, is "Yes."

This is not a "game" in the traditional sense. This is a sociological experiment with a terrible frame rate. Itâ€™s a high-stakes, player-driven drama where the zombies are merely the set dressing for the real horror: other people.

The 10/10 High: The Unscripted Masterpiece
There is, quite simply, nothing on the market that generates stories like DayZ. The highs are so astronomically high that they justify all the suffering.

You will remember, for years, the time you and a stranger, both armed only with flashlights, wordlessly teamed up to fight off a horde. You will never forget the 10-minute, high-stakes negotiation with a fully-geared squad that ended in a peaceful trade of beans for ammo. And you will definitely never forget the adrenaline of a 45-minute-long sniper duel in the hills of Chernarus.

These aren't quests. They aren't scripted. They are raw, emergent, human narratives. When DayZ works, it is the most sublime, heart-pounding experience in all of gaming.

The 4/10 Low: The "Jank" Engine
...And then there's the rest of it.

DayZ is a magnificent, beautiful, brilliant idea, held together with duct tape, stubbornness, and code that feels, at times, haunted. For every sublime moment of human drama, there are three moments where you die because your character decided to get stuck in a door-opening animation.

This is a game where your greatest enemies are, in order:

Other players.

Starvation/Dehydration.

A simple ladder.

The inventory system.

A single, very determined zombie who can somehow punch you through a solid brick wall.

You will spend 40 minutes playing "Running Simulator" across a gorgeous, empty landscape, only to find that the can of food youâ€™ve finally located requires a can opener you donâ€™t have. You will engage in melee combat that feels less like a desperate fight for survival and more like two drunkards trying to swat a fly with wet noodles.

The Verdict: A Flawed Classic (7/10)
This is the central paradox of DayZ. It's a game I both love and loathe. It is deeply, fundamentally, and perhaps purposefully, flawed.

A 7/10 is the only honest score. It is not a "perfect" 10, nor is it a "broken" 4. It's a 7, which in school-grading terms, is a "C+" â€” average, but passing. And that's DayZ: it passes the test of "Is this a unique experience?" with flying colors, but it barely scrapes by on "Is this a functional piece of software?"

It doesn't respect your time. It is obtuse. It is clunky.

And yet... I'm logging in again tonight. I need to get that car battery back to my base.

Final Score: 7/10 â€” A beautiful, broken, unforgettable disaster.

Dear Bohemia Interactive, first off, thank you from the bottom of all us gamer's hearts for the brilliant video game, secondly, my humble request, please repair the servers permanently and please fix the cheater issue. I am situated in Asia, I get above 150ms ping in asia servers, where there is mostly 3/100 players one of which is on chance a hacker, all other servers give ping too high to play, now even on DZSA launcher's custom servers there is a provider issue. The map chernarus is already too big for average player like me, we will not be interested in giving more money than the game cost us in sale to buy a DLC for a game in which anyways servers are broken with either lag issue or hackers. I have been following DayZ since the beginning in ARMA days, finally have a PC which can run it, please it is my humble request it is a great game and i would love to play it the way it was meant to be. Please fix servers and I will for sure buy DLC ^.^
One of the hardest survival games I've ever encountered, it's quite difficult to start but once you get into it it becomes the best survival game possible.

I Sold My Soul for a Can of Beans: A DayZ Review (And Why My Wife Almost Left Me)

It was 3:00 AM on a Tuesday. The rain was hammering against the window, but in Chernarus, the sun was shining.

I had finally done it. After four hours of crawling through bushes like a terrified hedgehog, I had the loot. I had a pristine M4 assault rifle. I had a tactical vest. I even hadâ€”and I cannot stress the luxury of this enoughâ€”a can of Tactical Bacon.

I was the king of the server. I was a survivor. I was a man of many talents.

Then, I met "Steve."

Steve was a fresh spawn. No shoes, no pants, just a glow stick and a dream. He waved at me. I waved back. "Friendly?" he asked over voice chat. "Friendly," I lied. (Okay, I intended to be friendly, but my finger was trembling on the trigger).

We bonded. We walked together for 20 minutes. I fed him half my bacon. I felt like a benevolent god. I told him about my real lifeâ€”about the neighbors, about the lady losing the plot on the left. Steve listened. Steve cared.

Then, I stopped to check inventory.

CRACK.

My screen went black. "You are dead."

Steve didnâ€™t shoot me. No, that would be too dignified. Steve hit me in the back of the head with a can of Heinz Baked Beans. My own beans. The betrayal wasn't just physical; it was spiritual.

The IRL Drama:
I didnâ€™t just sigh. I didnâ€™t just rage-quit. I stood up and screamed, "STEVE, YOU TRAITOROUS PIG!" at the top of my lungs.

The bedroom door flew open.

Enter my wife. She looked at me. She looked at the "You are dead" screen. She looked at the clock.

"Did you just wake up the entire neighborhood because you died in your little walking simulator?" she whispered. Her voice was scary calm.

"He... he hit me with beans, honey. After I gave him bacon," I stammered, realizing how insane I sounded. "I lost everything. My M4. My dignity."

She stared at me for a long, cold minute. "If you wake up the baby," she said, pointing a finger sharper than any DayZ bayonet, "I will make you eat cold beans for a week. Real ones. Go to sleep."

The Verdict:

DayZ is not a game. It is a psychological experiment designed to test how quickly you can develop trust issues. It is a walking simulator where the destination is always disappointment. It looks like 2013, runs like a potato, and the cars fly better than the planes.

Pros:
Beautiful scenery (while you starve to death).
Teaches you valuable life skills, like never trusting a man named Steve who isn't wearing pants.
Adrenaline rushes that are definitely bad for your heart.

Cons:
High risk of divorce.
I spent 6 hours looting to die in 3 seconds.
I am now emotionally damaged by canned food.

Final Score: Trash game. Broken mechanics. Toxic players. Iâ€™m logging back in tonight.

well there's not much to say after 2400H 
this game is like a drug , every server is a new adventure both in pvp or pve the fun is always there
The best sandbox survival game out there. Strongly recommend!

youll spend more time dying from other players, starvation/dehydration before any infected takes you out. 
the game is still a buggy mess even for its age but its still a fun game nonetheless

DayZ is a unique game that will captivate a specific type of gamer who enjoys:

- Multiplayer realistic survival with actual consequences
- Open world post-apocalyptic sandbox exploration
- Modern era very realistic FPS mechanics
- Ironman/hardcore gameplay with high stakes PVP

This isn't a game that holds your hand. You'll die from starvation, disease, other players, and countless mistakes you didn't even know you could make. But that's exactly what makes it special. Every encounter matters. Every decision has weight. The tension of hearing footsteps in a building you thought was empty, or successfully making it through a firefight alive; these moments stick with you.
DayZ was the game that made me personally make the switch from years of console gaming to PC, and I haven't looked back since. If you're willing to embrace the very steep learning curve and accept that failure is part of the experience, DayZ offers an unmatched survival game that no other title has quite managed to replicate yet.

Big Maps. Big Scary. Big Frustrating. Hugely Rewarding! 
A very engaging Survival Game with a big and active modding community.
The Vanilla experience is my Favourite though.

Highly realistic, Lots of fun with friends, Large skill gap but that's common with shooter games like Dayz. I don't reccomend it for everyone, but it is a lot of fun when you start figuring things out. Personally i do not like vanilla because it is boring and takes far too long. Take a look at mods and other custom servers thats where the pvp/ base building/ looting is more fun. thanks for reading

This has a very steep learning curve. It is more correctly called a simulation. If you do play this game on PC I would recommend playing on PVE (Player vs. Enviroment) servers first to become practiced in using WASD keyboard mapping. PVP play on high population servers is brutally difficult. I feel like console players have an advantage.

It brings me back to my childhood! Just wish they didn't make it so easy to kill your character. I also wich they didn't remove the handcuffs carrying over to other servers. I hated being taken hostage but it was so fun when I caught someone. Now you just disconnect and die. Still a fun game!

I hate this game with every fiber of my being. Even on console it made me want to cry. Story teller like no other.. that first experience of learning the game... encountering that friendly guy with no mic that helps you learn how to make a fire, and procede on a three hour treck through the woods, crossing tense plains with no cover, wolves hot on your tail, back to back barely fending them off... just to arrive at some airfield in the dark of night. He emotes to be quiet. Then we hear it. Laughing. Horrible laughing. In a moment your pal of four hours in gone. Me quivering in fear. Then it approaches. Laughing manically, begging begging for your life. It all goes black. 10/10.
game is good fun especially with mates. as far as modded servers go, The Labs AU is shit dont play it
Truely a great survival/combat game. I love stalking people for the whole day, killing them and then going home and playing dayz.
Immersive. Diabolical. High highs and low lows. I cannot stop playing this game. A masterpiece.

Always happy to play. I like the game but sometimes its annoying as there seems to be people cheating.

Without a doubt, one of the most entertaining and varied games I've ever played. You can access different maps, in addition to those from the DayZ community, and continually explore new worlds.

You can also focus your matches on PvP or PvE servers, allowing you to vary your gameplay experience each time. Every run is different for DayZ players, and that's something unique and exclusive to this game.

I hope the essence of the game can be maintained for many more years and that they continue developing it.
I have heard that vanilla game is garbage, started playing the game on modded server and I completely love it. Its awesome if you find the right server.

This game is geniunely suffering but fun, playing vanilla and modded are fun. I found so many friends playign this game and i played it with friends. This game will always hold a special place in my heart
One of the most in depth games I have ever played. Every life in the game is a new experience, but the game has a hard learning curve, otherwise it is a great game

One of the most dynamic, immersive and realistic games I've ever played. The real time interaction with other players, the survival mechanics and the guns are all incredibly made. Still active after all these years. When I'm playing this game, there's this sense of dread and fear. I feel on edge, as if I was actually in the situation in the game.

I absolutely fell in love with this game after watching a few streamers play it. Its an open world sandbox survival game that allows you to play how YOU want to play. If your a master PVP king or a Rookie survivalist, this game has what you need. Factions, nature, illness, interactions, action, Chill, tourneys, Roll play, ect. This game has it all.    The learning curve is steep. But once you get the hang of it, your going to love it.

Dayz is a game where it can be relaxing and maybe sometimes even "boring" (although thats not what id personally call it by all means) but when those moments of finding someone, getting into a gunfight and trying to stay alive from hordes of infected happen, it really gets you pumping. Love this game.
Amazing game if you love starving to death respawning dying of dehydration respawning again running for 6 hours then getting shot by a bush <3

Probably the most replayable game I have ever played, I have brought this game on pc 3 times, once on xbox. just cant get enough. Its a proper zombie game, hardcore survival the way it should be. Every other game in its catagory is basically a knock off. this is the real deal

Dayz Is more of one of those games that you need time and commitment for, Especially when it comes to looking for servers, finding what's comfortable, and finding the right community but I will say out of all the games in my library I would say its rare for me to have a bad experience on this game when there are so many good communities out there that can lend a hand if you need one. All in all its a game I would suggest to at least try whether its modded or vanilla depends on your interest.

I like this game but due to the big cheater problem on official servers the only think that keep this game alive for so many years is the community and that's a plus for me there are server for all your needs pve only pve/pvp zones pvp mods and so much more and thats a + for me i love this game

DayZ is a hardcore, immersive survival game set in a vast open-world apocalypse. You scavenge for food, water, weapons, and medicine while avoiding zombies and unpredictable players who can be either friendly or deadly. Every encounter is tense, and surviving even a single day feels meaningful.

The game nails emergent storytelling and player-driven drama, but it can be frustrating: inventory management is clunky, bugs and desync issues still occur, and long-term objectives are vague.

Realistic Score: ~7.8/10 â€” Incredible for players who love high-risk, emergent survival, but not for those seeking polished mechanics or structured gameplay.
Pain and suffering simulator. Remember, its never your loot. Its only your turn to have it for a while.

i dont have many hours on steam because i have a trash pc but on xbox i have nearly 2000 hours and this is my all time fav game it is the best $70 you will spend

if you do get this game be warned it can be very challenging but the feeling of accoplishment you get with this game is un like any other and when you have loot and you encounter another player you will get an adrenelin rush like youve never felt  but rember that what makes this game amazing is not the loot but the one of a kind experinces and the absurd antics that happen, the times when i didnt kill on site but instead talked or even shot them and and held them hostage and called truce and became friends after are memories i have held close to my heart for years

103 hours on this game, and i have nothing to say other than its worth it. this game will teach you many things, dont trust anyone, be ready for death, DONT EAT WITH BLOODY HANDS etc... its hard yes, but it will scratch an itch that no other game will. Every death is a new adventure, every POI you visit instead of a different one somehow altered it, every playstyle you chose will be a difference between prospering and going back to the coast, and with mods playstyles skyrocket, new unlocked ways to play or die. if you like games that will punish you for mistakes but will reward you for hard work this is your game.
learning curve is sorta steep. really hard at start, and fun once survival becomes second nature.

The time spent in this game was the most fun I ever had with friends that I never met in real life. Even with all the bugs or glitches and weird and clunky gameplay sometimes, it is one of the most exiting and adventurous game I ever played. Wish I could go back in time and play it like then.

some call it a walking simulator, others call it gay. i view this masterpiece as a friendship simulator. i have met many people across the beautiful Russian landscape some good and some bad. but the friendship along the way was pure and or backstabbing. i give this game a 20 out of 10 when compared to cookie clicker.
I have over 1000 hrs on this game on console. Its a great game if you like hardcore survival, but dont get me wrong its a love hate relationship. Youll never get bored.

DayZ is an incredibly intense and gripping survival game that constantly keeps you on edge. From the very first moment you step into its harsh, post-apocalyptic world, you feel the tension rising. Every decision mattersâ€”whether youâ€™re scavenging for supplies, navigating dangerous areas, or encountering other players who may help youâ€¦ or betray you.

What makes DayZ truly exciting is its unpredictable nature. No two experiences are the same, and the constant uncertainty about who or what you might run into next creates an atmosphere of pure suspense. The game rewards careful planning, awareness, and quick thinking, making every moment feel meaningful.

If youâ€™re looking for a nerve-racking, immersive survival experience that tests your instincts and keeps your heart racing, DayZ is absolutely worth playing.

Your Deniz

DayZ is an incredible survival experienceâ€”tense, immersive, and full of unforgettable moments. Itâ€™s tough to get into with its steep learning curve, but once you push past that, the sense of accomplishment and realism make it absolutely worth it...

I was on the hunt for a game that would let me escape into a world that was a relentless survival experience. I got that here. With a steep learning curve and a few lessons from YouTube University i was able to pick up the basics and i was off. Im not the biggest pvp gamer due to terrible hand eye coordination but the slower pace helped me get hooked. After 50+ hours on the official servers i gave the community servers a go and found a real gem. i can see myself playing this for a long time. Well done Bohemia and the modders, it was well worth every cent
With mods, this game is a great adventure. Without mods, its very hard to play as beginner.

A Brutal, Unforgettable Survival Experience

DayZ isnâ€™t just a gameâ€”itâ€™s an experience that sticks with you. Every session feels different, and every decision matters. The world is harsh, unpredictable, and incredibly immersive. Youâ€™re not just fighting zombies; youâ€™re fighting hunger, weather, and sometimes your own bad choices.

What makes DayZ special is the stories you create. One day youâ€™re scavenging alone in the woods, the next youâ€™re teaming up with strangers who might save youâ€¦ or betray you. No two encounters feel the same, and that tension is what keeps me coming back.

The atmosphere is unmatched: the sound design is eerie, the map is huge and full of hidden details, and the survival mechanics feel rewarding once you learn them. The game has come a long way over the years, and the updates have made it smoother, more stable, and much more fun to play.

If you enjoy genuine survival, player-driven stories, and high-stakes moments where your heart is pounding out of your chest, DayZ is absolutely worth it. Itâ€™s tough, unforgiving, and sometimes frustratingâ€”but thatâ€™s exactly why itâ€™s so memorable.

One of the best survival games out there. Bring patience, bring courage, and bring a can opener. Youâ€™ll need all three .
Very tuff game, the community is very helpful and almost everyone is nice.
Over 1k hours in this game and probably have not really experienced everything the game has to offer. There's alot of places to explore and wild things to discover in the private servers.
love game and kamyshovo cannibals but hard as a new player but very intresting 10/10

It's a great game. Great game mechanics, but the one thing I would have liked is more information when first loading into the game and how to survive. But there's plenty of Youtube videos nowadays to help guide you. Most other players you meet in the game aren't very friendly (which is to be expected)... otherwise i will continue to find enjoyment in playing it.

Always a great game to come back to and have a blast with my friends. Something about wandering around searching for loot, encountering different scenarios and different adventures just keeps bringing me back to it. Give it a go for a nice adrenaline boost haha

One of my first experiences of this game (literally maybe 20 minutes in?) I was asked for my name, and after refusing to respond, was knocked out and killed.

Then later on getting swarmed by a horde with my friend, who was killed by some guy, who I then killed, barely  made it out alive, and got food poisoning 3 times in a row.

Very memorable, 10/10, would recommend.
Still enjoying the game, most of the servers are modded which brings a whole new experience to the game.

negative.review: I like this game but due to the big cheater problem on official servers I cannot recommend it until it gets fixes.

This game used to be my favorite of all time, but now I cannot say the same. 

Every official server has cheaters. It is clear the devs do not even care. How hard could it be to install a new anti cheat into the game? Instead, they put all their assets into maps. Since official servers are unable to be played, this strips away 75% of the game that you are buying.

This leaves us with the other 25% of the game: community servers. Do not even think about playing these to avoid cheating. The admins of the community servers PLAY them, which means they are spawning in any item they would like for themselves. It is a total mess.

For these reasons, I would not recommend buying this game until they fix the key issue that is cheating. DayZ is not a fun experience anymore.

70 CAD for a glorified walking simulator with PVP sprinkled in every 40 minutes to 1 hr and 30 if you are lucky. And if you are even luckier that PVP encounter will be with a hacker.

Still, no other game lets you handcuff people after knocking them out with rubber slugs from your double barrel.

I play this game since 2013, it's so embarassing the zombies still move so bad and bugged AF afters more than a decade!
The devs only keeps raising the price and add useless things. So so disappointing

I want to preface by saying I played the mod all those years ago. It was fantastic. This one, not so much. A lot of bugs still, and when I say that I mean potentially game-breaking ones. 

97%+ of servers are part of a botnet that tries to install malicious Steam Workshop repacks and probably cryto-mine on your rig. The servers you do find are likely shit. Being a decade and a half old, people know all the best ways to raid your crap already, the best base spots are known, and any populated server you join I hope you have no attachment to any of your items or any real hope of.. "progressing" unless you've got 100+ hours and know your way around already. 

On that topic.. This game has no progression, and it masks it with the "hardcore survival" BS. It wants you to keep restarting to hide the fact that there is no real endgame. "Veterans" are just geared up with ghillie suits and SVDs with 40 buried and underwater stashes around the map sniping freshies who just spawned. There is really nothing to do once you master the mediocre survival aspects and aren't in a group messing around 24/7. Oh, I know! Let's loot another military base (maybe get sniped by a no life doing so). Or get an empty farmhouse with a damaged sweater and ballcap in it. I've not enjoyed the gunplay either. Despite once being an Arma-engine based game, the shooting feels clunky and requires adjusting to. The bullet velocity and drop isn't all that, either, and it moreso is to just add another layer of tedium. 

That's all this game is. Tedium tedium tedium. You spawn half starved and dehydrated so you spend 7-10 minutes filling those up every life. It adds up. Enjoy the iZurvive map because you're going to be looking at it an ungodly amount of time. No in-game map function and when you do eventually find one it's useless because it's essentially a piece of paper in game, doesn't track your location or make it worth using at all. There are MANY useless items they add pretending players will use them when really top players all just want a DMR and plate carrier. And yet, they refuse to fix any bugs. I've followed development all the years I didn't own this pile of trash - I waited this long for a reason. I finally gave in, and admittedly had some fun, but I can't recommend it in it's current state, or ever really. If they can't get it right after almost two decades it's pretty obvious this is a long-con cash cow a la Fortnite.

Have I mentioned the building oversights? Or lack of tutorials on building, or that you can lock yourself into your base with no warning? Or that a sharpened stick can break your metal wall if it pokes it for ~30mins while you're offline and some noob can just take (or drop to despawn) everything you own while you aren't playing? Even better, if you manage to avoid getting raided your base items only last ~45 days if you don't interact with them (yes I know flags exist but that's just more BS to add on) and server wipes completely remove your hard work every few months. I could go on.

 It's fun for a bit, especially with friends,  just kinda lame after a while. Bohemia.. How the f*ck did you guys only manage this much in 15 years? No story (not required but would've been nice to have by now), no finality, no progression of any sort. Even friggin' TARKOV- the most hardcore of masochistic shooters out there lets you keep the stuff you extract with. Virtual object attachment aside, it just isn't worth 25$ on sale (because they refuse to put it lower than that, cheap, greedy, prideful nitwits) and CERTAINLY not worth 50$ full price. 

Play Zomboid instead lol

its been years since this game came out i played the mod it came from, but the dumb fucks still dont take care of cheaters, just quit for the 4th time with offical servers, dude auto aimed me then just deleted metal fucking walls and tore my base to shit fuck the devs wish we could meet and i get a few good hits in for make me waste so much time when its your fucking job, just saying if i make a server expect a lawsuit because any cheater that joins it will have an automated deletion of windows 32, hope you enjoy the field of shit youve cultivated its one hell of a show. good thing i know people in cyber scurity theyer grate at coding shit that eats systems

A friend bought DayZ for me to join the friend group in playing. But just like every other lazy company (And FP's Rust), they just have a blacklist of automated banned IPs as a checkbox for server owners and claim it's an anti-cheat
So if the [b]non-human[/b] [u]automated system[/u] decides you match it. Then you are a cheater, and you are kicked/banned before even loading in and with no evidence

This game was so much fun while it lasted but ended with a whimper. I started on official servers and quickly realized the difficulty was partly due to hackers so I quickly loved to private servers. These servers are help by admins and individuals who use things like CFTools to check and ban cheaters. In theory this is fantastic, however all it takes is an admin from one community server to put you on the list for (whatever reason he wishes!). These aren't reviewed, controlled and are at the whims of admins. I ended up contacting CFTools to remove my info because I didn't want my precious account tarnished by a power tripping admin. So now I can either play official or a community server not using CFTools (most use it). Being at the mercy of individuals on a 40-50â‚¬ game and the mother company not caring about it's servers (no single player btw, so those servers are the main way to play).

In the end, I'd stay away unless you have enough friends or a group large enough to pay and play your own server. This game could be so amazing if these problems were dealt with, but it has been an issue since it's creating and it never changed.

Cons: Hackers, technical debt, bad server performance, fake servers in the master server list, they are simply to small of a team to manage this game. Barely afloat, barely enough resources to do anything related to technical debt.
Poorly implemented Enfusion engine, only halfway there.
Dev team was scaled down soon after full release, seniors usually leave the company, like Eugen Harton and Brian Hicks. Battleye does not work well enough against DMA cheats, server side anticheat is lacking, code changes this far in after all of these years are very resource heavy. The dev team only prioritizes content, security and stability. All devs are for the time being pretty locked to DLC crunch (Badlands)
The list goes on and on.

However many great moments and overall a good experience for veterans.


All in all very frustrating experience for new players, even after all these years, would not buy unless friends are veterans and are patient.

First of all, it doesn't feel like a game that's been in development for 10+ years. Nearly all systems feel like they were developed by a summer intern. The game is difficult for difficulty's sake. Do not buy if you have a life, or in another words, not okay with spending a thousand hours first just to start having fun.

IDK why I have so many hours in this game. I came back to play it after a long time away, and it is so incredibly boring. Starving to death simulator is not fun, the gunplay is terrible, driving is terrible, the loot is terrible. I understand wanting to make a "realistic" zombie survival, but the loot spawns are far from realistic, its just punishing for no reason.

Thats all the game is, punishing you for not knowing every single mechanic, and then punishing in every other way because "its post apocalyptic bro sounds like a skill issue." There is no skill in searching every single building for a gun thats damaged, has no magazine, has no ammo, and then going to another town finding damaged ammo for a different gun, and a damaged magazine for another different gun. 

Its just plain boring.

Most trash game Iâ€™ve ever brought! Definitely not worth its sale price. The developers need to lower the price or upgrade the gameâ€™s quality. Great concept for a game but terrible execution on progressive development.

My Opinion:
~ I didn't find any sort of enjoyment in this game. The mods did make it better, but it left a bad taste in my mouth that I'll never shake.

Quick Review: 
~ It's a half baked game with little to no content, that's being held together by a modding community.
~~ Huge props to the modding community, for trying to make the game what it should have been.

Review:

~Concept:
~~ The game was a fantastic concept, but was poorly executed.

~Technical:
~~ Game constantly has technical issues which makes it feel more like an Early Access Alpha version (not even beta). If you think Early Access is bad in Steam.... You have no idea.

~ Mechanics:
~~ The mechanics are pretty trash and haven't shown any signs of improvement. Between a lack of fluidity, low quality animations, and tedious / poorly balanced survival mechanics.

~ Empty Worlds:
~~ This ties back into technical issues and a major lack of anything really populated. The world seems lifeless and you can go hours without seeing much (Walking Simulator). 
~~~ Thanks to the wonderful modding community, they are the only saving grace. Keep up the great work modders!

~ Community:
~~ Very toxic and stick to their cliques. 
~~ This is not new person friendly (excluding the PVE mods). The overall design of the game encourages paranoia / hostility / toxicity, which in turn fosters aggressive tendencies and griefing. 

~ Bare Bones Sandbox:
~~ I do enjoy sandboxes, but the game is completely missing depth. There's little to no objectives, a major lack of things to do, player driven drama to make up for the shortcomings of the game (ties back into toxic community).

~ Brief Summary: 
~~ The only thing keeping this game alive is the modding community.

if your constantly on edge like i am then this is not a fun expeirience. i mean i already scream whenever someone opens the front door, i dont need a game to do that for me.

This game is a hunky pile of dogshit. I legitimately don't know why I bought it but I did and the only reason I can't refund this is because the game is a glorified walking sim that I hadn't realized brought my playtime past the refund point. I think I have been graced by god that I haven't encountered anything but long arduous walks in a depressive nature setting because from what gameplay I've seen, the prostate only gets fucked harder the more you lobotomize yourself through this medium.

I'm gonna be honest, I love this game and have dumped hours into it and learning about it. But it gets to a point.

CHEATERS!!! 

I love vanilla dayz, I love the map design and weapons, but the goddamn cheaters are getting to me.

Every time i load into dayz i'll have some fun, getting geared and boom, cheater

I'll try again and boom, cheater

I've ran into the most blatent cheaters, one that stick to me was about 2023ish and i was in bernizo after looting around the map and being alive for more than 50 hours with a handful of kills and good interactions, I was running the viaga and m-16 and was in the police staion looking for more 12g, and stayed in cover the entier time, then comes this weasel, this weasel says "thats a nice m16 you have there bob" I am on a first person server btw and you cant see names unless you type ingame, and i died, no sound, I just drop, its instances like this that make me wounder if there is even an anti cheat.

I hate playing modded servers due to over powered guns and armor but its almost impossible to survive without cheating yourself in vanilla dayz.(unless you are lucky and don't come across cheaters)

Take this review as a warning, if you are resilient and have the mental capacity of a monkey then i'd say give this game a try but if not, Don't bother wasting money learning the game and then realizing it's all been for nothing.

I rarely make reviews so heed that as a warning enough.
